department.dept_long_name: Department of Organismic and Evolutionary Biology

course.title: Biology of Insects
course.faculty_text: Naomi E. Pierce and Michael R. Canfield
course.description: An introduction to the major groups of insects. The life history, morphology, physiology, and ecology of the main taxa are examined through a combination of lecture, lab, and field exercises. Topics include the phylogeny of terrestrial arthropods with a review of the extant orders, an analysis of abiotic and biotic factors regulating populations, including water balance, temperature, migration, parasitism, mutualism, sociality, insect/plant interactions, medical entomology, and the use of insects in biological control.
